Authors: Fadillah C., Syamsuddin D., Sasongko R.
Title: The power of perspective on toys photography in one frame story
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fadillah, C., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Syamsuddin, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sasongko, R., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Toys Photography is a phenomenon that is still prevalent today. The emergence of toys photography has many reasons including the need of stories line as a way to make the toy characters come alive, and also closely related to the world of animation that carries a lot of scenes or stories in the toy industry. The emergence of toy products is also because of film production or advertisement as a medium for distributing the film or as a hobby either from animation and photography world itself. A perspective or viewpoint is very influential for scene or visual story. Thus it require different technique and handling between photos product with normal human eye perspective and smaller objects perspective of such as characters on toy products. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Giwanda, G., (2001) Menciptakan Foto Yang Menarik, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta; Giwanda, G., (2001) Panduan Belajar Fotografi, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta
